history.content:
Yes, I asked my advisor about this. After you fulfill your technical requirements, you aren't bound by the 2 techs per semester rule any more. Happy exploring!

-----

The above poster is right, but I want to add that you MUST take that natural science class next semester. The requirement is only lifted after you are done with all your degree requirements, so you can't do any random EECS class. Rather, it's gonna have to be like Physics 7C, Chem 1A, etc.
Yes, I asked my advisor about this. After you fulfill your technical requirements, you aren't bound by the 2 techs per semester rule any more. Happy exploring!

Hello, I am currently a third year undergraduate student in the EECS program, and I am also pursuing a major in another (unrelated) field. Since my curriculum up to this point has been mostly focused on EECS, I wanted to dedicate some time next semester to taking classes in my other major. I have already completed the upper division unit requirements for the EECS degree, but I still need to take my natural science requirement and ethics requirement before I graduate. My question is whether it's permitted that I take 1 EECS-related course next semester, given that the rules say the two technical course per semester requirement is lifted when you reach your degree requirements? At this point, I'm not sure taking more technical courses just for the sake of it would be good for me.
history.subject: When does the two technical per semester requirement stop applying in the EECS major?
